result.execSummary:
The defendant Jennifer M. Berge was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Forgery-Uttering [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.38(2).
  • Identity Theft-Financial Gain, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Identity Theft-Financial Gain, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
No contact with any of the victims of co-defendants unless they are in the same treatment court.
No use or possession of anyone else's personal identifying information.
No use or possession of illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.

Comply with any conditions/programming per agent.
Participate in (if accepted) and comply with/complete treatment court program.
Pay restitution.
Provide DNA sample and pay fee.

Administrative Transfer to Treatment Court
IT IS ORDERED: This case is transferred to Eau Claire County Circuit Court Branch 1 while defendant is a participant in the Treatment Court program. The case will be administratively reassigned back to the initial court upon defendant's successful completion of the Eau Claire County Treatment Court Program, or upon defendant's termination from that program.
